1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill

3.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
the heart (as the most interior organ);
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so

4.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth

5.brief: secure; in a bad sense, haughty

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

6.brief: to be tranquil, i.e. secure or successful
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

7.brief: to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

8.brief: desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
to ponder, i.e. (by implication) converse (with oneself, and hence, aloud) or (transitively) utter
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

9.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

10.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

11.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)

12.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

13.brief: adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

14.brief: to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve

15.brief: to inclose; by analogy, to hold back; also to maintain, rule, assemble
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

16.brief: adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
support or (by implication) ability, i.e. (direct) help, (in purpose) an undertaking, (intellectual) understanding
to stray, i.e. (figuratively) sin (with more or less apology)
to stray (causatively, mislead), usually (figuratively) to mistake, especially (morally) to transgress; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) to reel, (figuratively) be enraptured

17.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

18.brief: properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle
something girt; a belt, also a band
properly, the waist or small of the back; only in plural the loins

19.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
permanence; hence (concrete) permanent; specifically a chieftain
properly, to wrench, i.e. (figuratively) to subvert

20.brief: the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
properly, a taste, i.e. (figuratively) perception; by implication, intelligence; transitively, a mandate
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

21.brief: to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
properly, containing, i.e. a tube; also a bed or valley of astream; also a strong thing or a hero
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)

22.brief: to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)

23.brief: to grow, i.e. (causatively) to enlarge, (figuratively) laud
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)

24.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
a desolation (of surface), i.e. desert; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

25.brief: to feel of; by implication, to grope
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
intoxicated, as astate or a habit
